results.title: Aids: what everyone needs to know [Revised]
results.brief_description: An authoritative exploration of AIDS produced in cooperation with the UCLA AIDS Center. Discusses symptoms, transmission, diagnosis, how the body becomes prone to other diseases and the increasing danger to the general population. A family in which the husband has AIDS share their feelings.

results.title: Aids: not adults only
results.creator_credit: Cristina Pozzan, Ray Argall and Musical Films
results.brief_description: Four teenagers explore issues surrounding AIDS in frank and informative interviews with counsellors, other teenagers and a 19 year old who contracted the virus. Discusses how AIDS affects the current generation and challenges common misconceptions about the disease. The theme is prevention while simultaneously providing an opportunity for adolescents to review their attitudes and behaviour.

results.title: AIDS
results.creator_credit: Joanne Parrent and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: A broad approach that deals with the nature of AIDS, the means of infection, symptoms, prevention, advice and personal responsibilities in relationships. The comprehensive information involves no sexually explicit material and as such is particularly suitable as an introduction to the topic.

results.title: Aida
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Giancarlo Sbragia, Polivideo and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: This is a magnificent production on an epic scale of Giuseppe Verdi’s “Aida”, libretto by Antonio Ghislanzoni, recorded live at the Arena di Verona in 1981. Written by Verdi for the new Cairo Opera House which had been built to mark the opening of the Suez Canal, “Aida” is set in the golden time of the Egyptian Pharaohs and tells a tale of human drama and emotional conflict, of love, jealousy and manipulation culminating in a climax of tragedy. The lead singers include Maria Chiara (Aida), Fiorenza Cossotto (Amneris), Nicola Martinucci (Radames) and Giuseppe Scandola (Amonasro) accompanied by the Arena di Verona Chorus led by Corrado Mirandola, Orchestra conducted by Anton Guadagne and Corps de Ballet dancers Ileana Iliascu, Rosalba Garavelli, Georg Iancu and Richard Dusquenoy. Vittorrio Rossi’s stage sets and costumes are rich in color and design and the setting of the Arena di Verona is wonderfully atmospheric. Sung in Italian with no English subtitles.

results.title: Adaptive radiation: the mollusks
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the principles of adaptive radiation and shows how the typical molluscan characteristics are modified in each of the six classes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Actualization through assertion (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Barnett Addis, Larry King, Robert Liberman, Behavioural Sciences Media Lab and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Four clients are seen in group assertion training, developing a style by practicing appropriate eye contact, gestures, body movement, touch, facial expression & voice tone & volume. Therapists are seen directing the client’s progress and reinforcing small successes. Practice assignments are given in which newly learned skills are applied to situations in the client’s daily lives. Narrated by McDonald Carey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barnett Addis, Larry King, Robert Liberman, Behavioural Sciences Media Lab and University of California, Los Angeles

results.title: Acts of God
results.brief_description: Takes an entertaining and informative look at freak weather conditions - commonly referred to as “Acts of God” - and at how the human body stands up to their violent effects. Shows the design of windproof structures and their effects on people and looks at designing to meet these problems.

results.title: Act of necessity
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Pamela Williams, Channel 4 and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Act of necessity, set in rural New South Wales, explores the conflicts faced by a community whose health is threatened by the use of chemical sprays. One woman’s concerns are brought to a climax when her daughter becomes fatally ill and her search for answers is frustrated by a wall of bureaucracy. Beautifully photographed, it provides a compelling argument about the dangers of chemicals to the environment and the collusion of silence from people in power.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Munro, Pamela Williams, Channel 4 and Film Australia

results.title: Agnes, Maude & Pearly too
results.creator_credit: Erica Glynn, Alice Jacques, Charles Mitchell and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Two sisters meet up to play pokies on their deceased sister’s favourite pokie machine before scattering her ashes. Shortly afterward, their grief compounds and the truth of the past is revealed and confronted.
